intro: Ainsliaea angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ainsliaea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered inflorescences. The plant features slender, opposite leaves that are typically narrow and lance-shaped. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with five petals and prominent stamens. Ainsliaea angustifolia thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
